name: 金仕淳
objective:
The objective of the course is to learn how the digital image practicing in real world applications, especially on medical image and computer vision.
This class will introduce the composition of the image, image adjustment, composition, compression and feature extraction to apply on image detection and recognition. We will introduce some popular image processing algorithm about image processing and implement on medical imaging project.
schedule:
Week 1　　What is Digital Image Processing
Week 2　　Digital Image Fundamentals
Week 3　　Intensity Transformations 
Week 4　　Intensity Based Segmentation
Week 5　　Spatial Filtering and kernel function
Week 6　　Filtering in the Frequency Domain
Week 7　　Image Restoration - Recovery
Week 8　　Image Reconstruction
Week 9　　Midterm
Week 10　　Morphological Image Processing
Week 11　　Shape based Image Segmentation
Week 12　　Pattern Recognition and Description
Week 13　　Feature selection and Classifying
Week 14　　Image Compression
Week 15　　Medical Image format and processing
Week 16　　Final Project report (1)
Week 17　　Final Project report (2)
Week 18　　Final Project report (3)
scorePolicy: (1) Homework 20% (2) Midterm 30% (3) Final Project report 30% (4) Participation 20%
materials:
Reference:
1.Digital Image Process 4/e Gonzalez & Woods
2.The Image Processing Handbook 5/e John C. Russ
3.Medical Image Reconstruction: A Conceptual Tutorial Gengsheng Lawrence Zeng
4.Digital Image Processing Using MATLAB, 2/e Rafael C. Gonzalez, Richard E. Woods, Steven L. Eddins
remarks: MATLAB or Python programming skill are needed.
